com.yantra.api.wms.move

Interface releaseMoveRequest

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.WMSApi, YIFApi

    public interface releaseMoveRequest

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document releaseMoveRequest(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      releaseMoveRequest provides ability to release an existing move request.

    • Method Detail

      • releaseMoveRequest

        org.w3c.dom.Document releaseMoveRequest(YFSEnvironment env,
                                        org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                 throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                        java.rmi.RemoteException

        releaseMoveRequest provides ability to release an existing move request. For all request lines that are not tasked, move tasks for the request line are created. Once all the request lines for a request are completely tasked, move request status becomes "RELEASED". If any request line has exceptions, then move request indicates the same and move request status remains as 'CREATED'.

        Task Creation Strategy:
        Following is the algorithm used for creating Tasks

        • Activity Group Determination: Based on the move request line, base activity group can be either 'PUTAWAY' or 'RETRIEVAL', it is determined as follows:
          If source location is given: 'PUTAWAY'.
          Else if target location is given: 'RETRIEVAL'.
          In case of Case/Pallet source location is always known, so it always 'PUTAWAY'.


        • Task Type Determination and Task Creation: Based on the activity group, task type is determined differently.
          'PUTAWAY':
          • Inventory details are determined for the move request line.
          • If target location is not given, then target locations are determined by calling 'getPutawayLocations' API for each inventory.
          • If target location is given, then the behavior is, as if there is an activity demand for the inventory with target location as the location where the inventory needs to be moved.
          • For each inventory, put away strategy is determined by using best match Algorithm.
          • For the put away strategy, task type is determined by doing best match on put away strategy detail.
          • Best match condition for put away strategy selection: Put away strategy is selected using a best match criteria based on EnterpriseCode,UOM and ItemClassifications. The order of priority is: EnterpriseCode descending, UOM descending, ItemClassification1 descending, ItemClassification2 descending, ItemClassification3 descending.
          • Best match condition for put away strategy detail selection: Put away strategy detail is selected using a best match criteria based on SourceZoneId and TargetZoneId, SourceLPNType. The order of priority is: SourceZoneId descending, TargetZoneId descending, SourceLPNType descending.
          • If inventory is pallet and the pallet is getting split as a result of put away configuration then,
            • Pick task is created for the pallet with no target location. During execution of the task (i.e. in progress status) target location is suggested by getNextDepositLocation API. Allocation for the pick task is done i.e. a pend move record is created for the pallet.
            • Deposit tasks (one or more) are created for the each inventory detail of the pallet with target location (as determined by put away) and source location as blank. The source location will be the location where the pick task is finally going to be completed. For each deposit task allocation of inventory is done i.e. a detail level pend move record is created.
          • If inventory is loose sku or case/pallet (not splitting) then,
            • Tasks (one or more) are created for the inventory. Allocation is done for the tasks. At the source location, pend out quantity is increased by the task quantity (this is indicated by increasing the hard alloc quantity) and at the target location pending in quantity is increased by the task quantity.
          • Target locations pending in volume and pending in weight is increased by the capacity of the UOM/Case/Pallet.

          'RETRIEVAL':
          • Based on the details given in the move request line, tasks are created in two ways.
            • For ItemId, UOM, ProductClass and EnterpriseCode passed in the move request line, locations from where inventory is to be retrieved are determined by using Retrieval Strategy configuration.
              • Retrieval strategy is determined for the node ,activity Group (passed in the move request) and activity code as 'RETRIEVAL'. Retrieval Strategy would point to list of source zones which could be configured by uoms.
              • Based on the item details passed with the move request line, item-uoms are obtained. And appropriate strategy for those uoms are picked up in the descending order of item-uom quantity.
              • Source zone sets could be configured for each uom with a certain priority assigned to each of these sets.
              • Inventory is searched in each of zone set till the demand quantity is satisfied.If Inventory Status is passed in move request input, inventory with this Inventory Status will be searched in the source zone sets configured even if this Inventory Status is not part of source zone set configuration. If no Inventory Status is passed in move request input, then inventory with Inventory Status's configured in source zone set will be searched.
              • More information on how the pick location is determined can be found in Pick Location Assignment in releaseWave API.
              • Tasks created would belong to "Task Type" defined against the zone set.
            • In case if SKU details is not passed in the move request line, then inventory details along with the locations from where inventory is to be retrieved are determined by calling getNodeInventory API for the passed criteria in the move request line. The criteria can be either ItemId, receipt details or segment type along with the segment.

        If any line does not get fully tasked then, the move request line has exceptions and move request indicates the same and move request remains in 'CREATED' status.

        EnterpriseKey is a line level attribute of MoveRequest. Individual lines can have different enterprise code. So the tasks created also will have different enterprise key. EnterpriseKey will not be stamped on the summary task because of this.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        com.yantra.wms.japi.ue.WMSCanReleaseMoveRequestUE

        Events Raised:
        Raised during the transaction RELEASE_MOVE_REQUEST.

          ON_SUCCESS:
            This event is raised upon successful execution of releaseMoveRequest.
            Data published - WMS_RELEASE_MOVE_REQUEST.ON_SUCCESS.xml
          HAS_EXCEPTIONS:
            This event is raised if a move request cannot be released (cannot be fully tasked)
            Data published - WMS_RELEASE_MOVE_REQUEST.HAS_EXCEPTIONS.xml

        Audits:
        A status audit corresponding to move request is created (only if all the lines are fully tasked) with the following values in the YFS_Move_Request_Status_Audit table:

          OldStatus: previous status of the move request.
          NewStatus: RELEASED.
          OldStatusDate: date when status of the move request was last changed.
          NewStatusDate: Current DB Date.

        Pre Conditions:
        Move request being released should exist in the database.
        Move request should not already be in CLOSED status.

        Post Conditions:
        Move request gets updated to RELEASED status, if all the lines are fully tasked/cancelled.
        If for some reason a line could not be released fully then, line has exceptions and this is indicated by setting HasExceptions flag to Y. Move request indicates the same and remains in CREATED status.

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support: No

        Configuration Required for Backward Compatibility: No

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains the details of the tasks being created for the move request. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
